editor of a top-selling tabloid newspaper. Andy Coulson denies any knowledge of the hacking, but admitted he'd committed a cardinal sin for a back room operator-- he became the story. Andy Coulson said continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in his role as Downing Street communications chief. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on."

use of a private jet so he can fly between LA and London in comfort. But Simon Cowell has told the panicking bosses that the relentless travelling will be "too gruelling". A source said: They are at their wit's end. "The X Factor is ITV's biggest show and they can't afford for it to flop. It's getting to the point where they are literally willing to do anything in order to persuade Simon Cowell to appear in the live shows. "But the simple fact is he can't be in two places at once and he's not sure he wants to be.
